clinicalDescription: Overview: Physical and psychological reliance on opioids. Dependence means feeling withdrawal symptoms when not taking the drug. Addiction is a chronic brain disease that causes a person to compulsively seek out drugs, even though they cause harm. Presentation: craving, sweating, general discontent, chronic constipation, physical substance dependenceAssessment: Inability to control opioid use, self-diagnosable Plan: Medications such as methadone can help alleviate the symptoms of withdrawal and cravings. Pairing medication with inpatient or support programs generally has the most success. Prognosis: Can be managed successfully.
